pros: it is a good place to start
cons: it is not a good place to grow

job_title: Children's Services Coordinator in Woodlands New Town,
pros: Nice warm working environment with superiors very patient and willing to teach new comers the ropes. Certain flexibility is allowed (case to case basis). Good systems in force for all staff. Staff welfare & benefits is good. Good learning ground for fresh grads or new comers who are looking at having a long term career working in the children related services or social work arena. Lots of other job opportunities available within the organization itself.
cons: May have to work long hours at times when there is a shortage of manpower or when there is a sudden influx of projects flooding in at the same time with very close deadlines.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Yishun New Town,
pros: Understanding workplace. Some teachers try their best.
cons: Low salary. facilities not up to date

pros: Good culture Good support from management though work is tough
cons: slow career progression pay raise/increment dont seem to be transparent

job_title: Social Worker in Bedok New Town,
pros: Sufficient exposure to opportunities at work
cons: Small and sometimes heavy work load

pros: The staff culture is friendly and supportive and they provide good welfare for staff
cons: Internal training and structure can be enhanced to better accommodate worker's adjustment to the work

job_title: Senior Program Assistant in Toa Payoh New Town,
pros: Meaningful work, Able to help the community
cons: More like a retirement job

review_title: Overall good. Your day-to-day wellbeing depends which centre you go.
pros:
- purposeful work
- generally nice colleagues
- good management
cons:
- has typical social service resource constraints
- social work executives have a glass ceiling compared to social workers

pros: Colleagues are great. Management can sometimes be tricky to communicate with.
cons: Career progression questionable, unclear guidelines, lack of opportunities leading to slow promotion

pros: Warm, caring, nurturing, good governance and fairness for staff.
cons: So far not that i know of.

pros:
Has a strategic & a systems approach  to the work
Passionate & caring colleagues who are supportive 
Large social service organisation that allows for career development 
Senior management demonstrates servant leadership
cons:
Don’t expect a slower pace of work just because it is a non-profit 
Work is getting increasing complex due to stakeholder demands and digitalisation

review_title: good for first or last jobs
job_title: Assistant Executive in Toa Payoh New Town,

cons: pay and progress are atrocious

job_title: Head of Corporate Communications in Singapore
pros:
- Supportive culture
- Meaningful work and cause
- Progressive organisation
- Strong spirit of excellence
cons: No real cons. But don't expect a slower pace of work.

pros: Good work environment for my center but can't speak for all centers
cons: Favouritism is obvious and those people get promoted super fast. Those who are blacklisted never get promoted.

job_title: Social Work Executive in Woodlands New Town,
pros: Friendly colleagues with a strong team spirit, willing to help one another and a great place to learn from one another
cons: can be repetitive at times and boring at other times can be quite hierarchical and values social work graduates slightly more

pros: - Fun outings and corporate retreats.
cons:
- Very stressful due to lean manpower.
- HR doesn't bother to hire new staff because they can 'save cost'.
- When colleagues on leave, have to do 2-person workload.
- Higher management only talks about how to maximise profit and not lose money.
- Too much Christian 'religion' stuff. Weekly 'devotions', monthly 'church attendances'. How about spending this money to hire more staff?
- Keep talking about faith, but actually only care about money.
- Non-Christians will not get promotion because they are not oriented with the company 'Christian' values.

pros: Nice, warm and open culture!
cons: Career progression can be slow

review_title: Overall pleasant work experience but lack of openness in intervention choices
job_title: Social Worker in Woodlands New Town,
pros:
The Work Culture is good. 

There is work-life balance 

Good employment benefits
cons:
HR doesn't really get involved in matters of employee's resignation/dismissal

Narrow scope in choice of theories used for client intervention

pros: Great culture to have with boss and colleagues

review_title: The work is challenging and tests your patience.
job_title: Driver and Health Attendant in Singapore
pros: The working environment is good, colleagues get along well, working 5 days a week is a very good job.
cons:
1. The elderly are not easy to take care of.
2. The salary is lower and the money is not used much.
3. To be promoted, you must obtain a professional license.

worker development focus

send to training frequently

good management

pros: Good organisation in general - generous benefits and compensation. Salary is not consistent across service groups though, some is way below the recommended NCSS pay scale
cons: Poor management - not open to feedback, top down and doesn't provide much guidance/support. Do not look into staff development. Poor communication between management and staff
